definition: to join a group/to become a member
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together

sentences.english: Zhang says that she brought more money to the partnership, from her Wall Street savings.
sentences.chinese: 张说，她带来了一些华尔街积蓄的钱入伙。

sentences.english: The new partner shall bear unlimited joint and several liability for the debts of the partnership incurred before he enters into the partnership.
sentences.chinese: 新合伙人对入伙前合伙企业的债务承担无限连带责任。

sentences.english: Jia small gun take people up the hill to the partnership, welcome an old pimple.
sentences.chinese: 贾小枪带人上山入伙，老疙瘩表示欢迎。

sentences.english: We decided that he would come out.
The boy faltered for a moment before joining the group.
sentences.chinese: 那个男孩入伙之前犹豫了一会儿。

sentences.english: He tried to rope Ted in on that swindle.
sentences.chinese: 他想拉特德入伙参加那个骗局。

sentences.english: It was a ceremony, an initiation.
sentences.chinese: 那好像是个仪式，入伙仪式。

definition: lit. to board a pirate ship (idiom)/fig. to associate with criminals
to join a society, association etc
to act jointly/to form a partnership
to break into jail/to forcibly release prisoners
to rely on help from sb
to become sworn brothers or sisters/sworn (brothers)
to defraud/to swindle
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to form one's own group or school of thought/to set up one's own business/to establish oneself
to defect/to surrender/to capitulate
to offer official positions and material benefits in order to buy people's allegiance
to attract (customers)/to drum up (trade)
turncoat/traitor
(old) itinerant political adviser/(fig.) lobbyist/go-between/mouthpiece/also pr. [shuo1 ke4]
to conceive a scheme/to devise a plan
to try to gain sb's friendship
